title: Spending by foreign tourists in Japan hits record
text:
Spending by foreign tourists in Japan hits record 21 Oct 2015 at 20:47 1,073 viewed 1 comments 
People walk past illuminated trees on a rainy night in Tokyo on Oct 16, 2015. (Reuters photo) - + More Japan historical sites found vandalised TOKYO â€” Spending by foreign tourists in Japan hit a record 2.60 trillion yen (770 billion baht) in the January-September period, already surpassing the all-time high of 2.28 trillion yen for the whole of last year, the Japanese government said Wednesday. 
Spending in the July-September quarter totaled an estimated 1,000 billion yen, marking the first quarter during which spending by foreign tourists has topped the 1 trillion yen mark, the Japan National Tourism Agency added. 
The figures suggest that Chinese travellers continued their "explosive buying" despite concerns about a slowdown in the Chinese economy. 
The number of foreigners visiting Japan is also increasing, with an estimated 14.49 million visits to Japan between January and September, up 48.8% from the year before. The figure also exceeded a record 13.41 million logged for 2014.
